attachments.title: E143 – Brawl News with Gavin Verhey — Commanderin’ MTG Podcast
attachments.text: Gavin Verhey visits to explain the recent announcements about Brawl! Big things are happening and we support the format as a sort of gateway to EDH! Read Gavin’s article here: <https://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/announcing-brawl-championship-2018-08-14> Support the show! <http://www.commanderinmtg.com/donations> or <https://www.patreon.com/commanderinmtg> See our episodes on YouTube: <https://www.youtube.com/c/CommanderinMTGPodcastChannel> We’re on iTunes! <http://bit.ly/commanderinitunes> Submit your decks to be reviewed here: <https://www.facebook.com/groups/commanderindeckreviews> … Continue reading E143 – Brawl News with Gavin Verhey →
attachments.fallback: E143 – Brawl News with Gavin Verhey — Commanderin’ MTG Podcast

text: Summary?
Gavin answers questions from Twitter and talks up the upcoming Brawl even at GP Richmond.
Any hot news?

WotC is designing with Brawl in mind going forward, with more legendary creatures in the pipeline. No other set will have the same density as DOM, but it is on their radar. 

Their data shows a lot of Brawl being played, but currently folks have to request it at stores so there are places it is popular and other places it isn’t played at all, so folks say it’s popular or dead and the truth is somewhere in-between. There are hundreds of FNM sanctioned events across the country, but it is a format they are solidly behind going forward.
Cool
Nice. Good for them.

This whole 'triggersgate' on Twitter is weirdly vicious...

<https://twitter.com/LibrarianOfLeng/status/1031135762224500736>

At least I dont have to play with assholes at my kitchen table. You are not your DCI Number. #mtgunderground <https://twitter.com/JeffHoogland/status/1030809692208082944>

Don't attack people for making them play by the rules. Playing the game by the rules isn't unsporting.

text: What...am I looking at?
There's a twitter 'debate' about the sportsmanship of not reminding folks in competitive play about their triggers
Naturally, it being Twitter, folks on both sides are a little...assholeish about it.
I mean...jesus. Why is this a debate? This is stupid.
Because...people?
People are stupid.

They are, but at the same time, someone missing a non-optional trigger and you gaining benefit from it seems a little wrong too, (such as casting a spell through a Chalice of the Void) since the trigger shouldn't be allowed to be 'missed' - according to the rules of the game it happens. But then again, I don't play competitive for a reason.
There's really no reason to not keep supporting it. It's little investment on their end, and it accidentally supports commander as well
How so?
By putting a higher density of legends in sets than the past
I wouldn't call that an accident, more of a synergy
Regardless, it winds up supporting a popular format and maybe making a new one with little effort on their part
Oh, we're not talking about triggergate
Yeah, I'm down with more legends.
Hope it doesn't give Mark's pet argument about doing away with the legend rule any weight in R&D.

It does help Brawl that they’re going back-to-back with Dominaria and then Ravnica.
Both visits to Ravnica have had 20 legends each...
I imagine we’ll start seeing a bigger brawl push once rotation happens
Maro just mentioned on twitter/tumblr that nobody internally is on board with his plan
Nobody is on board with supporting brawl,
His plan to do away with the legend rule
It’s a dumb idea
That's good. But I do wonder if that will change at all if they keep stuffing sets with extra legends thanks to Brawl. Hopefully not.
It's a terrible idea.
Legend would become a tag like "devoid."
if they ditch the legend rule, then helm of the host is just another card
kind of a bad card if we look at mana cost
I mean, does it make the game more complicated? Yup. But that doesn’t mean it’s a good idea
And it's not like it makes the game complicated in an ungrokkable way
Its' not less intuitive than flying

The trigger gate thing is stupid as hell. It’s non competitive players trying to make competitive players feel bad for “morality” reasons and competitive players telling non competitive “git gud”. It’s so stupid.
Yeah. We already know competitive players are morally flexible.
It’s not even a morality thing. Trying to make it one is silly

It’s apples and oranges. People like playing competitively can coexist with those that don’t. Nobody is forcing either of them to play like the others. If you have problems with how others play just don’t play like or with them
It's like cEDH or regular EDH trying to get the other side to play by their mindset.
Exactly
If it’s not for you, go find something that is. The game is big enough for everyone
I have a personal problem with someone gaining benefit if they miss a non-optional trigger, such as casting through a Chalice, bs missing may triggers.
But I don’t play competitively so what I think doesn’t matter.
Then don’t play competitively and you won’t have to worry about it
Which is what I just said.
Right, I think we hit send at the same time
Jinx!
Your face
My theory on triggergate... i’d more afraid of people thinking i’m a dick than liking to win. Like i’d rather walk away and have more people like me than to be closer to winning a couple of packs
There are many people are the opposite. You can be good and be an asshole. Two different axes
When given the choice of being right and being kind, choose kind (quote from wonder). I just sort of feel bad for the asshole when they rules lawyer intentionally.
It's different in EDH with no prizes
Most of the people having this argument aren’t talking about edh. They’re talking like, pro players and such
Some try to call hoogland an asshole because he would cast into chalice and see if his opponent misses it and then say how at their kitchen table etc etc.
There is so much crossing the streams and round pegs into square holes
Hoogland was probably unnecessarily caustic, but I get his point as his level
Yes, he is an asshole, but not for his stance in this specific instance
But people just see hoogland and automatically agree or disagree before they read his tweet
But that scenario he’s trying to gain value by creating an invalid game state.
That trigger goes off and he knows it. It isn’t a May. That’s my issue.
I understand the hold ups on both ends
Sure. Unfortunately the rules of the game are true for both sides.
TBF, there is risk in casting into a chalice. He's down resources.
You know what really pisses me off? When movies give their sequels names and extra, vague words tacked in instead of telling us where in the sequence the movie lies.
Underworld, underworld 2: (insert edgy word here), underworld 3: (insert extra word here). Is that too much to ask for?
Rogue One: Star Wars Zero
no wait
Star Wars 3.14159
Exactly
Han solo: probably recent enough for Jedi’s but they’re still just some cooky religion everyone forgot about 10 years later in a universe with unlimited technology
that was something that confused me
everybody thought that the jedis were myth and legend
like, they literally were peacekeepers around the ENTIRE galaxy 20 years ago
Mm...Trumpian levels of Propaganda for 20 years could cause people to believe they were always a myth.

hey guys so I've been playing around with this idea for a while now. Im an evolutionary biologist and make tribal decks based on certain evolutionary taxa (fungus, treefolk for plants, merfolk for fish, dinosaurs, etc) and was thinking of how I could turn this into an interesting article series by talking about what inspires me to go about a theme like this, how WOTC draws from real science and biology in their creature design, but am nervous about if it would appear too scientific, too out-there for edhrec, etc. Would like some opinions on what you would expect and like to see in an article about this topic. What would make you keep reading?
Go for it...we need more takes from a very different angle in MTG content
This would be an amazing series.
awesome, thanks for the support, what kind of stuff would grab your attention or interest you
I think doing a series based on the 'tree of life' concept to show how things branch and intertwine, if that's possible.
could you explain a bit more what you mean by that
I would love such a thing
But do you think about reverse-engineering their (art) designs then?

I envision a tree model that lists the main creature 'families' (human, goblin, treefolk, etc. ) but from their base evolutionary parts (simian for man, who knows for the others, go nuts!) and as the tree grows and branches off we get offshoots, (demi-human races, orcs, saprolings, etc. )
ah i see
We still have apes in Magic, but also half human, elves, etc.

so my initial thought came from looking at my slimefoot deck, and how slimefoot is based on a specific type of fungus, whereas thallids are based on different kinds, and so are others represented among the multiverse. Saprolings, which fungus create, also are based upon a specific portion of the lifecycle of fungi, and relate mechanically into the theme, especially with spore counters
maybe connecting that into the overall tree of life, and then having a decklist at the end for that tribe
Right - but having a deck that's 'all in the family' including all the branches/offshoots or have an 'evolutionary maybeboard' folks can consider to include that still remain within the 'tribe'
aaaah, interesting
i think that might be *very* difficult for some tribes, fungus included, while easier for others
but something like verdeloth, which is a treefolk but facilitates the growth of saprolings
Tweak to taste, of course. You could have some 'evolutionary inflection points' where two decks built from evolutionary ancestors have to battle for their right to continue!
haha interesting!
title was gonna be Evolutionary Leap
I like it
ill write up a draft tonight, see how far I can get, and then get some more opinions
so like, merfolk vs an actual fish deck, which is better
am i understanding that right?
or dinos vs birds
apes vs humans
aaaaaahhh
ok ok i see
i have the most ideas on fungus right now, so im gonna brainstorm that quickly
Of course!
Y'know...some say zombies are merely dead bodies reanimated by certain fungi...
... :wink:
i was thinking of having zombies represent bacteria
or viruses
That works too
im liking the idea of a sort of head to head segment. im not sure how many times i can do that but i like the concept
Infect vs. allies
I'm just spitballin' here
eh, that begins to get away a bit from my theme
thanks for the suggestions! this is all super helpful
spiders vs insects
I know, I know...when you said viruses I turned to infect
that works!
for example would be good
xira arien jund insects vs thantis jund spiders
I like it
The 'head to head' doesn't have to be central, but can be a thing you bring up periodically if you don't want to manacle yourself.
good point
the *survival of the fittest* section
so to speak
Just do it where it makes sense and is fun.
Indeed!
Make it more of a treat
Gives the series the chance for some more longevity for you.
awesome, thanks
who was it that already wrote something like this for the dinosaurs of ixalan?
Jus did over a million damage w a Whitewater Niads with a stock precon Estrid
[[whitewater niads]]
